intro: Dryandra ferruginea subsp. flavescens, commonly known as the golden dryandra, is a shrub native to southwestern Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, showcasing drought resistance through its succulent stems and reduced leaf surface. It belongs to the family Proteaceae, which is known for its showy, often brightly colored flowers. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
